thread.title: Congress Sends MASSIVE Message To Israel, But It’s What Trump Said That Has Netanyahu Replying
thread.title_full: Congress Sends MASSIVE Message To Israel, But It’s What Trump Said That Has Netanyahu Replying

author: Chris Golden
title: Congress Sends MASSIVE Message To Israel, But It’s What Trump Said That Has Netanyahu Replying
text:
Obama’s Unbelievable Last-Minute Lie Just Exposed How Smart The Vote To Beat Hillary REALLY Was 
According to the Washington Examiner , the House resolution is scheduled to be voted on this Thursday, two days after the new 115th Congress is sworn in. Given that the Republican Party will have a 241-194 advantage in the lower chamber and a 52-48 advantage in the Senate, passage should not be a problem. 
The resolution is being sponsored by House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy (R-CA), and House Foreign Affairs Committee Chairman Ed Royce (R-CA). 
“This administration has lost all credibility when it comes to Israel,” the two representatives said. “The administration’s stunt at the U.N. hurt our ally Israel and made peace in the region even more difficult to achieve.” Advertisement - story continues below 
“This Thursday, the House will not abstain from its responsibility and will vote on a bipartisan resolution reaffirming our longstanding policy in the region and support of Israel,” they added. 
The resolution, while not binding, is the latest sign that the Republican 115th Congress plans to tackle the topic of Israel right at the start. 
Last week, the Washington Free Beacon reported that several highly-placed congressional sources said that Congress was ready to cut back American funding to the United Nations and might even expel Palestinian diplomats over the recent vote on Israeli settlements. 
Sen. Ted Cruz , (R-TX), has been one of the most vociferous on the Republican side of the aisle when it comes to the Obama administration’s actions. He told the Free Beacon that, “President Obama, Secretary Kerry, Ambassador Power, and their colleagues should remember that the United States Congress reconvenes on Jan. 3, and under the Constitution we control the taxpayer funds they would use for their anti-Israel initiatives.” Advertisement - story continues below
